name: Hawaiian BBQ Vegan Pizza
description: This Hawaiian BBQ Vegan Pizza has tasty barbecue tofu pieces, fresh pineapple, homemade vegan mozzarella cheese and more!
recipeIngredient: 1 Recipe Easy Stretchy Vegan Mozzarella Cheese
1  pizza dough, store bought or homemade

recipeInstructions.text: If you are making your own barbecue sauce and pizza dough, and vegan mozzarella, grab the recipes and make those first.
recipeInstructions.name: If you are making your own barbecue sauce and pizza dough, and vegan mozzarella, grab the recipes and make those first.

itemListElement.text: Preheat the oven  to 350 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Preheat the oven  to 350 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: Pat tofu dry with paper towels, and cut into very small pieces (1/4 inch). Toss in a bowl with the soy sauce, place on parchment paper lined baking sheet, and bake for 25 minutes.
itemListElement.name: Pat tofu dry with paper towels, and cut into very small pieces (1/4 inch). Toss in a bowl with the soy sauce, place on parchment paper lined baking sheet, and bake for 25 minutes.

itemListElement.text: Remove from the oven, mix in 1-2 tablespoons of barbecue sauce, and put back in the oven for 10 more minutes. Set aside. Increase the oven to 425 degrees F.
itemListElement.name: Remove from the oven, mix in 1-2 tablespoons of barbecue sauce, and put back in the oven for 10 more minutes. Set aside. Increase the oven to 425 degrees F.

itemListElement.text: Roll out your pizza dough, place it on a pizza pan, and spread with about 1/3 cup of the barbecue sauce. Top with the tofu pieces, dollops of cheese, red onion slices and pineapple.
itemListElement.name: Roll out your pizza dough, place it on a pizza pan, and spread with about 1/3 cup of the barbecue sauce. Top with the tofu pieces, dollops of cheese, red onion slices and pineapple.

itemListElement.text: Bake for about 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and red pepper flakes, if desired. Slice and serve.
itemListElement.name: Bake for about 10-12 minutes until the crust is golden brown. Sprinkle with chopped cilantro and red pepper flakes, if desired. Slice and serve.
